title: Music Streaming
content:
Okay; I am setting up my Musical Composition Page (Edit: Down), and I was hoping to make the files undownloadable, just so that they'd stream. I thought just uploading it as .mp3 would work... but the first thing my dad did when he say the page, was just right click, and choose "Save target as". Then he smirked, and said, "So this is your 'Protected Content?'"

Dang it... so I need to know how I can let people listen to my music, without downloading it.

How?

BTW - Your free to download it if you want.Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society

title: Re: Music Streaming
content: I don't know, since I prefer downloading the file instead of streaming. Why do you need to be able to stream them, that I don't understand. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Music Streaming
content:
Indeed, I too prefer to be able to download a file only once.

I don't know much about streaming audio, but from what I've seen, the 'streaming' files (the one which launch the stream) are some sort of shortcut for whatever audio program playing it to look for the actual file it's supposed to stream.

Opening these files up in Notepad allows you to find the location of the actual file and download it. This sort of streaming hardly protects your content from download.

At least, that's how some .asx and .rm stream files appear to work.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

content:

Streaming would prevent people from downloading it.

BTW - How do you do the notepad thing?

You can download the files, but hurry.

Someone tell me how to stream!!!Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society

content:

title: Re: Music Streaming
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I will get it for my pages, and for my friends... does it cost money?[hr][/quote]
Copyright is automatic - just put a copyright notice at the bottom of your pages. However, it's unlikely that even the best of your work will be stolen to make money - usually, some random person on the internet will steal it and claim it as their own, mainly to look cool. As long as you make sure people know you did it and they ripped it off, it's unlikely to be a problem.[url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url]
[url=http://www.last.fm/user/grafix5000/][img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img][/url]

I put a copyright on it, we have been working on some of the songs in class, I own the frikin website, I have lirixs for the song Lord Jesus stored on my computer, and they will date further back then anyone else who claims to have written it. title: Re:  Music Streaming. . .
content:
To be honest I don't think it's worth the effort to register - it's extremely unlikely that anyone capable of stealing your songs would actually find them and decide to steal them, and even if they did all they'd have to do is change the songs slightly and claim they came up with it independently.

I'm not sure how intellectual property works in the US but I'm pretty sure in Australia a musical composition would be considered someone's intellectual property, and for that I'm sure you only need to prove that you composed the song first. So if you print out the sheet music and get a GP/lawyer/solicitor/etc. to date and sign it, then that's enough proof of the date you wrote the song, should anyone claim to have written it first. Then any additions won't be so difficult as you can either claim you based them on the original song (which you can do since you own it) or you can just get the changes signed off as well if you're really paranoid.

content:
